intro: Psychotria salicifolia var. ou-hinnae, commonly known as the Hainan psychotria, is a species native to southern China, particularly Hainan Island. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and small, capsule-like fruits. It is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
